description._content: Photographer: Unknown, Non-Indian Subject: George Gustav Heye (GGH), Non-Indian, 1874-1957        Frederick Webb Hodge, Non-Indian, 1864-1956        Harmon W. Hendricks (Harmon Washington Hendricks), Non-Indian, 1846-1928 Date Created: 1918 Catalog Number: P11804 Format: Albumen print Dimensions: 3.25 x 4 in. Collection History: Between 1917 and 1923, the MAI mounted the Hendricks-Hodge Expedition to explore and excavate the historic Zuni village of Hawikku, one of the most extensive projects of its kind in the Southwest. Documentation of MAI expeditions and excavations often includes photographs of camp life and expedition members. Description: George Gustav Heye and Frederick Webb Hodge (1864-1956, MAI staff member) excavating at charred stairs of old mission church; Harmon W. Hendricks (1846-1928, MAI trustee) in background under sunshade umbrella next to camera on tripod; unidentified man on the right Place: Hawikku (Hawikuh) Pueblo ruins; Zuni Reservation; Cibola County; New Mexico; USA Site Name: Hawikku (Hawikuh) Pueblo ruins Culture/People: A:shiwi (Zuni) (archaeological),Non-Indian Culture Hierarchy: Pueblo>A:shiwi (Zuni) (archaeological) Persistent URL:http://www.americanindian.si.edu/searchcollections/item.aspx?irn=313976 Repository:National Museum of the American Indian View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
